title: Temperature model version comparison
text:
Introduction
The EcoHSEDS temperature model gets updated approximately annually as new data are submitted to the database. Each update produces a new version. Here we examine changes in predictions between version 1.3 (Sept 2021) and version 1.4 (Jan 2024). In particulare we, focus on 2 areas with significant increases in data between versions, the Neversink in NY and the Potomac in Virginia.

title: 1Â  Load data
text:
1.1 Potomac
Mean July temperature


Code
plotAll(d2WideP, "mean_jul_temp_3", "mean_jul_temp_4")





Code
plotByHUC(d2WideP, "mean_jul_temp_3", "mean_jul_temp_4")





Mean August temperature


Code
plotAll(d2WideP, "mean_aug_temp_3", "mean_aug_temp_4")





Code
plotByHUC(d2WideP, "mean_aug_temp_3", "mean_aug_temp_4")





Mean Summer temperature


Code
plotAll(d2WideP, "mean_summer_temp_3", "mean_summer_temp_4")





Code
plotByHUC(d2WideP, "mean_summer_temp_3", "mean_summer_temp_4")





Mean maximum temperature


Code
plotAll(d2WideP, "mean_max_temp_3", "mean_max_temp_4")





Code
plotByHUC(d2WideP, "mean_max_temp_3", "mean_max_temp_4")
